Class Memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Memory

  • public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object
    Memory.java Memory provides a basic implementation of physical memory in the context of operating systems.

    • Method Detail

      • mallocFF

        public void mallocFF(Job j)
              throws NoFreeMemSegmentsException
        Tries to allocate a given job to memory according to the "First-Fit" allocation strategy.
        Parameters:
        j - the job to be allocated
        Throws:
        NoFreeMemSegmentsException - There is no free segment to allocate in memory.
        See Also:
        Job

      • mallocBF

        public void mallocBF(Job j)
              throws NoFreeMemSegmentsException
        Tries to allocate a given job to memory according to the "Best-Fit" allocation strategy.
        Parameters:
        j - the job to be allocated
        Throws:
        NoFreeMemSegmentsException - There is no free segment to allocate in memory.
        See Also:
        Job

      • dealloc

        public void dealloc(Job j)
             throws JobNotInMemoryException
        Deallocates a given job from main memory.
        Parameters:
        j - the job to be deallocated
        Throws:
        JobNotInMemoryException - The designated job does not exist in memory.
        See Also:
        Job

      • getWastedSpace

        public int getWastedSpace()
        Returns the current total of unused segment sizes.
        Returns:
        total size of unused space (in MB)
